answers.answer: Hi, thinning of the intestinal walls can occur due to inflammatory disorders like crohn's disease or ulcerative colitis. It could also be due to diverticulitis. Metabolic causes like diabetes mellitus can cause autonomic neuropathy and consequent thinning of the intestinal tract. As colonoscopy was normal any inflammatory colon disorders can be ruled out. The other causes for the pain could be infections of the bowel and bladder or prolapsed intervertebral disc. Regards.

question: My husband had a colonoscopy, came back good, he still is having pain in his side so he had a scan showing intestinal walls are thin, what does this mean?
title: Thinning walls of intestine
